titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Newtown record abstracts 1977.303
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:18:55 +0000.

did.abstract: The collection consists of newspaper clippings from an unidentified newspaper featuring record extracts from the town of Newtown, Long Island, dated 1734 to 1759. The extracts consist almost entirely of indentures, and include references to African-Americans.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. This collection was formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Guide to the Newtown record extracts, 1977.303, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
